You are given a string of length $n$ consisting only of the characters "a", "b", and "c". You will be given $q$ queries. Each query is a pair $(pos, c)$ where $pos$ is the index of a character in the string and $c$ is a character ("a", "b", or "c").  Each query replaces the character at position $pos$ with character $c$.

After each query, you need to find the minimum number of characters you need to replace in the string so that the string no longer contains the substring "abc" as a subsequence. A subsequence is a sequence of characters that can be obtained from a string by deleting some characters without changing the order of the remaining characters.
